alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 21 at 9:37PM EST until November 22 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow changing to rain late tonight or early Wednesday morning. Snow accumulations between 1 to 3 inches in the Merrimack Valley and other lower elevations, with 3 to 6 inches at higher elevations across western portions of Merrimack and Belknap Counties. * WHERE...Belknap and Merrimack Counties. * WHEN...Until 8 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...A weather system will bring a period of snowfall to the region tonight. Snow may fall heavily for a few hours making for slippery roadways. A change to rain is expected late tonight or early Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
